content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production Facility
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (x=-14.0, y=-53.0) supplying iron ore to a wooden chest at position (x=-12.5, y=-54.5).
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-19.0, y=-65.0) supplied with iron ore from the chest at (x=-12.5, y=-54.5).
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-21.0, y=-62.0) supplied with iron ore from the chest at (x=-12.5, y=-54.5).
- Stone Furnace at position (x=0.0, y=0.0) supplied with iron ore from the chest at (x=1.5, y=0.5).
- Burner Inserters at positions (x=-20.5, y=-66.5) and (x=-17.5, y=-64.5) moving iron plates to a wooden chest at position (x=-16.5, y=-64.5).

### Copper Ore Mining Facility
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (x=-23.0, y=-68.0) extracting copper ore and depositing it into a wooden chest at position (x=-23.5, y=-69.5).
- Transport belts connecting the mining drill to the chest.

### Coal Mining and Distribution System
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (x=53.0, y=-83.0) extracting coal and depositing it into a wooden chest at position (x=52.5, y=-84.5).
- Transport belts and inserters distributing coal to various furnaces and drills.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors with Transport Belt Blockage
- Ensure that transport belts are clear of any blockages to allow continuous mining operations. Clear the belt at position (x=-14.5, y=-54.5) to continue mining.

### Inserter Waiting for Source Items
- Ensure that the source items are available for inserters to pick up. Check inventory and supply chains to avoid idle inserters.

### Fuel Source Full Warnings
- Regularly check and manage the fuel levels in mining drills and furnaces to prevent overfilling and ensure continuous operation.
